pages.text:
County of Marin EMS
April 2025 BLS O 1
OBSTETRICAL EMERGENCIES
Indications
Patient reports or demonstrates vaginal bleeding and/or imminent delivery (need to bear down,
pushing, have urge for bowel movement)
BLS RMC
• Calm/reassure patient
• Save and transport any passed
tissue
Vaginal bleeding Imminent delivery
• Supine or shock position, if pregnant • Prepare sterile/clean area for delivery
place in left lateral position • Assist with delivery
• Observe for development of shock • Dry, warm, and stimulate all newborns
• If immediately post-partum, consider • Prepare for possible multiple births
fundal massage • Prepare for possible childbirth related
complications
• Assess for possible neonatal
resuscitation
APGAR SCORE
Sign 0 1 2
Pink body with blue
Appearance Blue or pale Completely pink
extremities
Pulse Absent <100/minute >/= 100/minute
Grimace No response Grimacing/weak cry Vigorous cry
Activity Limp Some flexion Active movement
Respirations Absent Slow, irregular Good, crying
SPECIAL CONSIDERATION
Prepare for rapid transport in both situations
